alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Cumberland; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 7:01PM EST until February 17 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Clinton, Cumberland, Monroe and Russell. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 PM CST, Dispatchers reported flooding of roadways in low-lying areas. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tompkinsville, Albany, Jamestown, Burkesville, Leslie, Russell Springs, Gamaliel, Claywell, Bow and Bakerton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
